Part 1

Here something you don‚Äôt seem to understand, and it is obvious because I have worked for and been trained by the Federal Government in the handling of Classified Messages. When something is put out, that is Classified, whether Top Secret, Secret or Confidential, when it is Declassified, the markings on the pieces of paper don‚Äôt magically disappear. Also, the only person who is (normally) allowed to declassify a Classified Item is called the Original Classification Authority, that is the Person or Entity that originally Classified the Item in Question. The ONLY exception to that, is the President of the United States. He is sometimes called the Ultimate Classification Authority, as he has the power to Declassify ANYTHING in the Government. The Definitions for these are SUPPOSED to be: Top Secret ‚Äì Information whose disclosure will cause Exceptionally Grave Damage to the United States of America, Secret ‚Äì Information whose disclosure will cause grave damage to the United States of America, and Confidential ‚Äì Information whose disclosure will cause damage to the United States of America. Unfortunately, today, too much information is classified because it will cause EMBARRASSMENT to the individual Classifying the data.

Part 2

For instance, there have been times in the past (mostly in the mid ‚Äò90s) when I would read some classified document, while listening to the TV (tuned to CNN, and Bernard Shaw) and what was being said on the TV was almost word-for-word what was in the Classified Document I had in my hand. 

The reason I say all of this is, or should be, simple, as the ultimate Classification Authority, the President has the power to Declassify anything he wants, and we do NOT know what documents that are ‚ÄúMarked‚Äù are actually Classified. Has he declassified them? I would NOT trust the DOJ to tell me whether the President has Declassified a DoD Document, as they, in all likelihood have never seen it. They‚Äôre just going off the physical markings on the paper. Something that, as I previously noted, doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean it is STILL classified.

So when Trump stated yesterday that the fbi removed the classified documents from the boxes, dumping them on the floor for a photo op, was he lying? 
When his legal team filed in court that a special master must have a security clearance, that‚Äôs because nothing was classified?

replies.context: Pursuant to the National Defense Act and a standing executive order, the Director of National Intelligence would have had to have signed off of the declassification.

Not necessarily, the President has the ultimate authority regarding the declassification of documents. There is an outstanding legal question as to whether he is required to do it in writing or can do it ad-hoc.

There is no outstanding legal question as to whether Trump or any president, once his term of office has ended, has a right to retain government documents, especially top secret documents. The answer is NO.
Trump supporters keep on insisting that because theoretically Trump had ultimate power to declassify documents, he could do what he pleased. (By the way, Trump's attorneys have not made that argument in court, just like during their contesting the outcome of the 2020 election, they never made before a judge the same outlandish claims they made to the media. ) Also, does anyone have any evidence that there existed such a standing order that when Trump moved stuff to his private residence it magically was declassified?
